result.execSummary:
The defendant Skyler W Burns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time. Sentence credit of 4 days were granted if imposed.
Consecutive to: Present sentence

May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: Present sentence

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

No Contact with victim. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. AODA Assessment and follow through. Absolute Sobriety. Comply with random urine screens. 
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Skyler W Burns

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 12/16/16

Defendant is granted a release/stay of sentence from the Waukesha County Jail on Tuesday, December 20, 2016, from 1:30 pm to 7:30 pm, to attend the funeral of his Grandmother, Johanna C. Kuehl. Signed by Judge Carter on 12/14/16.
Received today, from the Defendant's mother, requesting that the Defendant be allowed release for his grandmother's funeral.   Sent to Judge Carter for review.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Dated today, from the Court to the Defendant, in response to inmate communication received on October 20, 2016. The request for Huber privileges is denied.  This was a serious offense and the court ordered straight time if probation were revoked.  There is no basis to change that original determination.

WC jail inmate communication form received today from the Defendant, requesting to serve imposed sentence with work release.   Sent to Judge Carter for review.
10/21/16, Per Judge Carter: The request for Huber privileges is denied.  This was a serious offense and the court ordered straight time if probation were revoked.  There is no basis to change that original determination.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Skyler W Burns in court with Attorney Geoffrey Misfeldt and Attorney Michael Hart.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information. State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Hart makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME (4 Days credit, if revoked)  **CONSECUTIVE TO PRESENT SENTENCE** 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR    **CONCURRENT WITH PRESENT SENTENCE**  **TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victim
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $243.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted, remainder to be returned to poster)
Defendant's brief in support of Motion in Limine to introduce evidence under wis. stat. 972.11(2)(b). Filed by Atty Hart and Attorney Misfeldt.
Defendant's motions in limine. Filed by Atty Hart and Attorney Misfeldt.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Jury status hearing on January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Jury status hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
